DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate whether delayed ( i.e . 28 ± 4 day post-transplant ) administration everolimus transplantation reduces risk wound heal complication comparison immediate administration de novo renal transplant patient ( proportion patient without wound/surgical complication relate initial transplant surgery ) randomization 3 month transplantation
DOC.brief_title: Everolimus de Novo Kidney Transplant Recipients
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Patients willing able participate study provide write informed consent perform study related procedure ; Men woman ≥18 year transplant ; Recipients 1st 2nd single kidney transplant decease donor living unrelated/related donor > 14 year ; Exclusion criterion : Patients recipient multiple organ transplant , include two kidney ; Historical current peak PRA > 50 % . Patients already exist antibody donor ; Thrombocytopenia ( platelet < 75,000/mm³ ) , absolute neutrophil count < 1,500/mm³ , leucopenia ( leucocytes < 2,500/mm³ ) hemoglobin < 7 g/dL ; Body mass index ( BMI ) > 30 Kg/m2 ; Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply
